item.title: 不能说杰罗姆-鲍威尔是个大预言家
item.description:
美联储在利率问题上的表现完全符合预期。不管怎么说，一日游游客们还是接受了这一点。【原文：

The Fed did exactly what was expected on rates — nothing. Daytrippers got on board with it, anyway.

】

item.title: 印度最大炼油商恢复使用 Sovcomflot 船舶进行俄罗斯石油贸易
item.description: 印度石油公司本周恢复购买由 Sovcomflot PJSC 拥有的一艘油轮运送的俄罗斯原油，这为恢复俄罗斯和印度之间的石油运输铺平了道路，此前美国收紧的惩罚措施中断了石油运输。【原文：Indian Oil Corp. resumed buying Russian crude oil delivered on a tanker owned by Sovcomflot PJSC this week, paving the way for a restoration of oil flows between Russia and India, after tightened US penalties had disrupted shipments.】

item.title: 前 SocGen 交易员称因银行未能发现他的赌注而被解雇
item.description: 法国兴业银行（Societe Generale SA）驻香港的一名前交易员声称，在该银行发现风险管理系统未发现的高风险押注后，他被解雇了。【原文：A former Hong Kong-based Societe Generale SA trader claimed he was fired after the French lender unearthed risky bets that went undetected by its risk-management systems.】

item.title: 必和必拓的巨额竞购让中国矿商看到了机遇
item.description: 必和必拓集团（BHP Group）以 390 亿美元的巨资收购竞争对手英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc），这可能是十多年来最大的一笔矿业交易，在此之后，包括中国国有铁矿石买家在内的中国主要金属公司正在考虑下一步行动。【原文：China’s leading metals companies, including its state iron ore buyer, are considering their next moves following BHP Group’s blockbuster $39 billion approach for rival Anglo American Plc, potentially the largest mining deal in over a decade.】

item.title: 瑞士信贷面临 3600 万美元的韩国卖空罚款：朝鲜
item.description: 据报道，瑞士信贷集团（Credit Suisse AG）因在韩国非法卖空而面临500亿韩元（约合3600万美元）的罚款，韩国当局将于本周五公布对这一行为进行更广泛调查的最新情况。【原文：Credit Suisse AG reportedly faces 50 billion won ($36 million) in penalties over illegal short selling in South Korea, where authorities are due to give an update on their broader investigation into the practice on Friday.】

item.title: Olam 提高对澳大利亚 Namoi 公司的收购要约，就在最新的最不发达国家竞标之后几天
item.description: Olam Agri Holdings Ltd.提高了对澳大利亚Namoi Cotton Ltd.公司的收购报价，超过了竞争对手路易达孚公司（Louis Dreyfus Co.）的报价，使两家顶级农产品贸易商之间的竞购战升温。【原文：Olam Agri Holdings Ltd. sweetened its offer for Australia’s Namoi Cotton Ltd., topping a proposal from rival Louis Dreyfus Co. and heating up a bidding war between two top agricultural commodities traders.】

item.title: 日元持续走软，日本企业举步维艰
item.description: 日本企业对日元疲软表示出不同寻常的不安，而日本政府似乎正在出面支撑其不断下跌的货币。【原文：Japan’s companies are expressing unusual discomfort with the weak yen, just as the country’s government appears to be stepping in to prop up its tumbling currency.】

item.title: 贝莱德、Citadel 从澳大利亚基金收获数十亿美元交易
item.description: Man Group Plc、贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：Man Group Plc, BlackRock Inc. and Citadel are among big winners from the giant alternatives portfolio held by Australia’s sovereign wealth fund, which has revealed the size of its mandates for the first time.】

item.title: 吉姆-奥尼尔称美国可能加强对日元汇率走势的口头干预
item.description: 吉姆-奥尼尔（Jim O'Neill）认为，美国官员已经在密切关注日元走势，他们可能会采取更加 "具体 "和 "公开 "的言论来帮助日本稳定其货币颓势。【原文：US officials already have a watchful eye on the yen and may resort to more “specific” and “public” rhetoric to help Japan stabilize its currency rout, according to Jim O’Neill.】

item.title: 美联储声明和日元波动刺激黄金上涨
item.description: 由于美联储在维持利率稳定时的鹰派基调不及预期，且日本当局疑似进行干预以支撑日元，从而损害了美元，黄金走高。【原文：Gold edged higher as the Federal Reserve struck a less hawkish tone than expected when holding interest rates steady, and Japanese authorities were suspected to have intervened to support the yen, hurting the dollar.】

item.title: 孟山都公司 1.85 亿美元多氯联苯判决在华盛顿被驳回
item.description: 拜耳公司（Bayer AG）旗下的孟山都公司（Monsanto）说服了华盛顿州的一家上诉法院，撤销了陪审团对西雅图地区一所学校三名前教师的 1.85 亿美元赔偿，这些教师将其脑损伤归咎于接触了该公司的有毒化学品。【原文：Bayer AG’s Monsanto unit persuaded an appeals court in Washington state to throw out a $185 million jury award to three former teachers at a Seattle-area school who blamed exposure to the firm’s toxic chemicals for their brain injuries.】

item.title: 澳大利亚企业实力令最大贷款机构也感到震惊
item.description: 近几个月来，澳大利亚企业对利率上升的抵御能力令交易员和经济学家大吃一惊。现在，澳大利亚最大的企业贷款机构的老板说，他也被吓了一跳。【原文：The resilience of corporate Australia to rising interest rates has taken traders and economists by surprise in recent months. Now, the boss of the country’s biggest lender to businesses says he’s been caught out too.】

item.title: 印度 Anthill 为私人信贷交叉基金寻求 1 亿美元资金
item.description: 在中国经济放缓的背景下，投资者纷纷涌向亚洲国家，印度 Anthill Ventures 公司计划推出一支专注于初创企业领域的混合基金。【原文：Indian-based firm Anthill Ventures plans to launch a hybrid fund focused on the startup sector as investors flock to the Asian nation amid a slowdown in the Chinese economy.】

item.title: 杰罗姆-鲍威尔为市场提供缓刑。转瞬即逝
item.description: 周三，当美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，尽管存在通胀压力，但他认为不会加息时，华尔街的交易员们欢呼雀跃。但欢庆并未持续太久。【原文：Traders on Wall Street cheered on Wednesday when Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled he didn’t see oncoming interest-rate hikes despite inflationary pressures. The celebration didn’t last long.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，美联储的下一步行动不太可能是加息。日元在纽约尾盘飙升。埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）推翻了白宫称赞的协议。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Jerome Powell said the Fed’s next move is unlikely to be a hike. The yen surged in late New York trading. Elon Musk upended a deal the White House saluted. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 中国资金暂停流入，香港股市反弹面临考验
item.description: 未来几天，香港股市反弹的主要买盘力量之一将退出市场，这很可能使市场失去一个重要的支撑点。【原文：One of the chief buying forces behind Hong Kong’s world-beating rally is out of action for the next few days, likely leaving the market without a crucial pillar of support.】

item.title: 美国石油库存激增凸显需求担忧，石油价格维持跌势
item.description: 由于美国原油库存跃升至 6 月份以来的最高点，加剧了人们对需求的担忧，原油持续下滑。【原文：Oil held a slump as a jump in US crude inventories to the highest since June added to concerns about demand.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将下跌，日元在暴涨后持平：市场综述
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔淡化进一步加息前景后，亚洲股市周四开盘下跌。【原文：Asian equities were primed for a downbeat open on Thursday following declines in US stocks after Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell downplayed the prospect of further interest rate hikes.】

item.title: 英国商业地产贷款降至十年来最低点
item.description: 由于交易量下滑，银行变得谨慎，去年英国商业地产贷款下降了三分之一，达到十年来的最低点。【原文：Lending to UK commercial real estate dropped by a third last year to the lowest in a decade as deal volumes tumbled and banks turned cautious.】

item.title: 日本神田：我们是否干预日元问题无可奉告
item.description: 日本最高货币官员周四早些时候在东京发表评论时，拒绝证实当局是否已介入外汇市场，此前日元大幅走强。【原文：Japan’s top currency official declined to confirm if authorities had stepped into the foreign exchange market early Thursday in Tokyo, in a comment following a sharp strengthening of the yen.】

item.title: 星展集团利润超出预期，原因是贷款和财富管理费增长较快
item.description: 星展集团控股有限公司（DBS Group Holdings Ltd.）第一季度利润增长，原因是这家新加坡最大的贷款机构继续受益于较高的贷款收入和强劲的财富管理费用。【原文：DBS Group Holdings Ltd.’s first-quarter profit rose as Singapore’s biggest lender continued to benefit from higher lending income and strong wealth management fees.】

item.title: 日本怀疑公司逃避披露交叉持股情况
item.description: 日本正在加大对大量交叉持股公司的压力。【原文：Japan is increasing pressure on companies with extensive cross-shareholdings.】

item.title: 芝加哥熊队体育场提案对普里茨克来说 "不可行
item.description: 伊利诺伊州州长 J.B. 普利兹克（J.B. Pritzker）的发言人周三表示，芝加哥熊队（Chicago Bears）目前提出的部分资金来自市政债务的新体育场提案对该州来说是 "不可行的"。【原文：The Chicago Bears’ current proposal for a new stadium financed partially with municipal debt is a “non-starter” for the state, a spokesperson for Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚 Vidio 公司力争在首次公开募股前将用户数量翻番
item.description: Vidio公司是印度尼西亚对Netflix公司的回应，其目标是在未来两三年内将付费用户数量翻一番，达到800万，并计划在这个流媒体仍有很大发展空间的市场上市。【原文：Vidio, Indonesia’s answer to Netflix Inc., is aiming to double its paid subscribers to 8 million in the next two to three years ahead of plans to go public in a market where streaming still has much room to grow.】

item.title: 更便宜的鸡肉吸引消费者，为朝圣者之傲注入活力
item.description: 全球最大的家禽生产商之一 Pilgrim's Pride Corp. 因美国鸡肉需求上升而获得提振，其盈利超出预期。【原文：Pilgrim’s Pride Corp., one of world’s largest poultry producers, is getting a boost from rising demand for chicken in the US, posting earnings that beat expectations.】

item.title: 巨灾损失减少，AIG 盈利超预期
item.description: 美国国际集团（American International Group Inc.【原文：American International Group Inc. reported profit above analysts’ estimates in the first quarter as lower-than-expected catastrophe losses contributed to strong underwriting results.】

item.title: 大都会人寿实现盈利，批准回购 30 亿美元股票
item.description: 大都会人寿保险公司（MetLife Inc.【原文：MetLife Inc. reported earnings that beat analysts’ expectations for the first quarter.】

item.title: 摩根大通有望在第三起监控案件中支付 1 亿美元
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）刚刚解决了两个监管机构对其贸易监控计划漏洞的投诉，预计将再支付 1 亿美元，以解决另一个监管机构的相关调查。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co., fresh off settling complaints from two regulators over gaps in its trade-surveillance program, expects to pay an additional $100 million to settle a related inquiry from another watchdog.】

item.title: Vista支持的汽车数据公司Solera秘密申请上市
item.description: Vista Equity Partners 支持的汽车数据和软件服务提供商 Solera Global Corp. 已秘密提交首次公开募股申请。【原文：Vista Equity Partners-backed automotive data and software services provider Solera Global Corp. has filed confidentially for an initial public offering.】

item.title: 交易员对干预风险忧心忡忡，日元数分钟内暴涨 2
item.description: 纽约尾盘，日元兑美元升值超过 2%，这加剧了人们对日本当局可能采取干预措施支持日元的猜测。【原文：The yen advanced more than 2% against the dollar late in the New York session, fueling speculation that the Japanese authorities could be intervening to support the currency.】
